info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 17 at 2:09PM MDT until April 17 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning Continues For This Afternoon... .The Red Flag Warning remains on track as gusty winds are expected to continue through the afternoon and early evening hours. Drier air is starting to filter as RH values as low as 15% have been observed. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT /9 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 079, 080, 081, AND 252... * Timing... The driest conditions are expected during the afternoon hours. * Winds...Northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 15 percent. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised. * Additional Details... A southeast to northwest wind shift is expected is occurring across the forecast area. The wind shift is anticipated to be fully through the warning area by mid afternoon with gusty northwesterly winds occurring. Critical fire weather conditions are possible for an hour or two just outside the warning area as well, outdoor burning through the remainder of the afternoon is high discouraged.
info.instruction: Avoid creating sparks. Take notice of any local burn bans. If a fire does develop, be alert for changing wind directions, especially during the early afternoon.
